table.insight: Delay in payment to MSME Vendor
table.description: Interest on delayed MSME payments must be recognized as an expense under the MSMED Act but may be omitted.

table.insight: Payment Beyond 60/180 Days since Due Date
table.description: Extended payment terms beyond contractual due dates may attract interest, late fees, or penalties, increasing expenses in the P&L.

table.insight: GST Interest Loss due to non payment (180 days)
table.description: Non-payment of GST within 180 days results in disallowance of input tax credit and accrual of interest liability, increasing expenses in P&L.

table.insight: GST Interest Loss due to non payment (60 days)
table.description: Delay in payment of GST beyond the due date (60 days) results in interest liability on outstanding tax, increasing finance costs in P&L.
